A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
There were 2 main jobs here. 
1)Do not screw up the character of Luke Skywalker.
2)Give Rey the much needed character development she deserves.
Not only did they screw up both of these points\, they screwed up basically everything but the CGI. 
In this horrible movie you will meet Luke "Get off my Lawn" Skywalker and Rey "Mary Sue".  In Disney's Star Wars you can become a Jedi without even wanting to\, kind of stumbling into it really. It seems that a couple lessons will take you there. Are the lessons long and complex you ask? Maybe\, if you are pre-schooler is my response. Perhaps\, you do have the attention span of a pre-schooler. 

We didn't even get a freaking light saber duel.
